results.title: Welcome to the dollhouse
results.brief_description: Todd Solondz’s debut feature is a darkly funny and bleak tale of the trials and horrors of high school outsiders. “Welcome to the Dollhouse” exacts with excruciating and all too familiar detail the ritualistic and cut throat pecking order of a New Jersey high school. In the title role Solondz has found an unusual alter ego in eleven year old Dawn Wiener (Heather Matarazzo), whose thick glasses, social awkwardness and infantile dress sense have marked her with the cruel nickname of Wiener dog. This has made her into the prime target for every high school bully including Brandon (Brendon Sexton the 3rd), a vicious delinquent who is constantly threatening to rape Dawn after school. Brandon’s promise of sexual assault become one of the many obstacles Dawn must deal with in her unrelenting journey through puberty, along with unsympathetic parents, a younger prissy sister that is unbearably wholesome, and a painful crush on the dreamy school rebel Steve (Eric Mabius). Cast also includes Daria Kalinina, Matthew Faber and Dimitri Iervolino. (Awards: Winner of the Grand Jury Prize at the 1996 Sundance Film Festival)

results.title: Welcome to Television (1956)
results.brief_description: Gyngell is often credited as being the first person to appear on Australian television on 16 September 1956, when he spoke the words, ‘Good evening, and welcome to television’.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.title: Welcome to Sarajevo
results.creator_credit: Channel Four Television, Miramax Films, Graham Broadbent, Damian Jones and Michael Winterbottom
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, “Welcome To Sarajevo” is a rare example of the war genre, one prepared to indict the western world for its refusal to aid the victims of a modern warzone like the former Yugoslavia. British journalist Michael Henderson (Stephen Dillane) begins a series of reports on a Muslim orphanage where dozens of children are trapped without food or medical support. His reports become pleas for help and finally scathing editorials before he takes matters into his own hands. Director Michael Winterbottom is careful not to paint Henderson as a hero, but rather the most ordinary of people forced to react against a heartless international community. With a cast that also includes Kerry Fox, Woody Harrelson and Marisa Tomei, “Welcome To Sarajevo” is a different approach to the war genre - one in which no one involved is morally black or white.

results.title: Welcome back, Norman
results.creator_credit: Sharon Burke, Film Communications, Mt Lemmon Production and Shevard Goldstein
results.brief_description: The comical character, Norman Krasner, is presented once again in this sequel of “Norman Krasner”. As a character who can turn common misfortune into near disaster, Norman depicts the weary businessman returning from a business trip. The setting is a busy airport’s parking lot. Norman turns the simple experience of getting out of the parking lot into a hilarious example of “Murphy’s Law”. Cast: Doug MacIntosh.

results.title: Weirdo
results.brief_description:
A short created by a student for the 2004 ACMI Diegesis secondary school media festival.
The story of a ‘weirdo’ guy, who’s best friend is a bird. They shop together and and live in harmony, until the ‘weirdo’ guy’s evil twin brother steals the bird. ‘Weirdo’ guy goes in pursuit of his evil twin brother up a mountain in a desperate attempt to save his best friend. A struggle ensues and, whilst ‘Weirdo’ manages to save his best friend, alas, his evil twin brother falls to his death off the mountain edge.

results.title: Weird science
results.creator_credit: Joel Silver, Universal Pictures and John Hughes
results.brief_description: John Hughes wrote and and directed this teen farce. Gary and Wyatt are two unpopular geeks in high school who fantasise about having beautiful girlfriends and being the coolest kids in school. Inspired by a clip from the classic film “Frankenstein”, the two decide to try their luck at creating the woman of their dreams. The result is Lisa - beautiful, saucy and the answer to every man’s dream - who becomes a mentor to the two libidinous youths, her mission being to help them get the young women they want. Cast includes: Anthony Michael Hall, Kelly LeBrock, Ilan Mitchell-Smith, Robert Downey Jr. and Bill Paxton.

constellations_other.name: Femme fatales to fembots (PLACEHOLDER)
constellations_other.description:
When women gain power, men get scared. You can see this in the mysterious, seductive and deadly femme fatale. Using her sexuality and intellect to manipulate, control and co-opt power, the femme fatale reflects prevailing attitudes to women.

NOTE: Toll of the Sea and 102 Dalmations to be replaced with exhibition objects.

results.title: Weipa people
results.creator_credit: Jane Scragg, Scope Films, Comalco and Edwin Scragg
results.brief_description: A film about the largest bauxite mining operation in the world. Also looks at the social conditions of the people who have moved to this remote North Queensland town and the impact of the new town on local Aborigines. Commentary by Richard Oxenburgh.

results.title: Weight training for sport
results.creator_credit: Town and Country Productions and Bill Latto
results.brief_description: The National Coach to the British Amateur Weight-lifting Authority, Mr Al Murray, instructs pupils at a London gymnasium in weight training techniques. Demonstrates how the correct exercises can increase athletic proficiency in all fields of sporting endeavour.
